description: Smallest prime p of two consecutive primes, p < q, such that GCD( p-1, q-1 ) = 2n.
comments: Since all consecutive primes, p < q and p greater than 2, are odd, therefore GCD( p-1, q-1 ) must be even.
example: n = 49: a(49) = 604073 because GCD[604073-1,604171-1] = GCD[6164.98,6165.98] = 98 = 2n. For n = 4, a(4) = 89 because GCD[89-1,97-1] = GCD[8.11,8.16] = 8 = 2n and these primes are the smallest with this property.
